intro: Taraxacum ligerinum, commonly known as the Ligerine dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces a distinctive yellow flower that develops into a white, fluffy seed head, typical of the dandelion genus. Its leaves are alternate, basal, and have a rough, hairy texture. Taraxacum ligerinum is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in disturbed soils.
